 File path: dev/tasks/tasks.yml
 ##########
 @@ -16,36 +16,42 @@
 # under the License.
 
 tasks:
+  # supported keys
+  # - name: arbitrary task name
+  #   branch: defaults to name
+  #   platform: osx|linux|win
+  #   template: path of jinja2 templated yml
+  #   params: optional extra parameters
 
 Review comment:
   Having the template be a .travis.yml or .appveyor.yml file only in need of template processing seems potentially inflexible to me. Here is a possible alternative:
   
   * tasks.yml provides the path to a task definition file (which could be YAML)
   * The task definition file contains the platform, parameters, and additional information needed to process the task. The idea here would be to make the task definition file more modular; so simple tasks could just be a templated .travis.yml, but we wouldn't be constraining ourselves to that model
   
   My guess is that as time goes on, more of the logic for each task will move from templates to Python code, as a means of improving code reuse.

fields.description: Travis should trigger daily cron jobs. I'm currently experimenting with submitting direclty from the queue repo's master branch, see https://github.com/kszucs/crossbow/blob/master/.travis.yml

comments.body:
[~wesmckinn] [~cpcloud] Where do we want to run the cron job which fires the tasks?

On travis we can setup daily builds, but not possible to further specify it.
On appveyor we need to ask the support for scheduled builds https://www.appveyor.com/blog/2017/11/08/sheduled-builds-for-free-accounts/.

Apache INFRA? 
Self hosted server?
I've added a sample configuration file: https://github.com/kszucs/arrow/blob/1e2c9b576baeadd2f9be1b572ca5ce6142849fc9/dev/tasks/nightlies.sample.yml
We could try to use the Apache Jenkins build server: https://builds.apache.org/. One question is whether this might expose some security credentials

Daily cron jobs are triggered by travis, see https://travis-ci.org/kszucs/crossbow/builds/405486378
It works so far, later We can improve this if needed.

Closing the ticket.
